intro: Lasianthus obscurus, commonly known as the dark lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Lasianthus obscurus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
